meanings.definition: A person or thing that squeaks.
meanings.sent1: The little mouse was a squeaker as it ran across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The old door was a squeaker every time it opened.
meanings.sent3: The toy car, a squeaker, seemed to have a secret to tell with each squeak.
meanings.sent4: In the quiet room, the squeaker of the chair seemed to echo like a tiny trumpet.
meanings.sent5: The squeaker in the choir added a unique charm to the performance.

meanings.sent1: The game was a squeaker with only one point difference in the scores.
meanings.sent2: The election turned out to be a squeaker with a very close margin.
meanings.sent3: The race was a squeaker, making the audience hold their breath until the end.
meanings.sent4: Her success in the competition was a squeaker, surprising everyone with the narrow win.
meanings.sent5: The debate was a squeaker, leaving the judges with a tough decision to make.

meanings.sent1: The mouse made a squeaker as it scurried across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The squeaker of the kettle signaled that the water was boiling.
meanings.sent3: The bird's song had a squeaker that stood out among the other sounds.
meanings.sent4: The squeaker of the violin filled the room with its melodious tone.
meanings.sent5: The squeaker of the brakes made everyone turn their heads in surprise.
